meanings.definition: In a childish or immature manner
meanings.sent1: He puerilely stomped his feet when he didn't get his way.
meanings.sent2: She puerilely giggled at the silly joke.
meanings.sent3: The puppy puerilely chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The wind puerilely danced through the leaves, creating a playful melody.
meanings.sent5: The children puerilely splashed in the puddles, laughing joyfully.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a child in a negative way
meanings.sent1: His puerilely selfish behavior annoyed his friends.
meanings.sent2: The movie's puerilely simplistic plot failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a puerilely disdainful look at the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: The politician's puerilely petty remarks tarnished his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The old toy had a puerilely faded color, reminding of its former glory days.
